channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Where Hundreds of Undocumented Migrants Have Died in Custody
item.description: Malaysia launched a “year of enforcement” in response to a surge in undocumented migrants, many of them from Myanmar. Some faced nightmarish fates.

item.title: Trump to Pardon Juan Orlando Hernández, Honduran Ex-Leader Convicted in Drug Case
item.description: Juan Orlando Hernández was accused of receiving millions in bribes and partnering with cocaine traffickers. He was convicted in Manhattan in 2024 and ...

item.title: State Department Boosts Resources to Process Business Visas for South Koreans
item.description: The Trump administration has been trying to repair the damage from the detention of hundreds of South Koreans in an immigration raid in Georgia.

item.title: Trump’s Response to Shooting Shows Intensified Anti-Migrant Stance
item.description: The president is furiously demanding limits on migration and attacking ethnic groups as he steps up his efforts to equate immigration with crime and e...

item.title: South Africans Were Promised Job, but Ended Up ‘Going to War’ for Russia
item.description: The South African government is investigating how more than a dozen men unwittingly ended up on the front line in Russia’s war on Ukraine.

item.description: The Trump administration has been trying to repair the damage from the detention of hundreds of South Koreans in an immigration raid in Georgia.

item.description: The president is furiously demanding limits on migration and attacking ethnic groups as he steps up his efforts to equate immigration with crime and e...

item.title: South Africans Were Promised Job, but Ended Up ‘Going to War’ for Russia
item.description: The South African government is investigating how more than a dozen men unwittingly ended up on the front line in Russia’s war on Ukraine.

item.title: Where Hundreds of Undocumented Migrants Have Died in Custody
item.description: Malaysia launched a “year of enforcement” in response to a surge in undocumented migrants, many of them from Myanmar. Some faced nightmarish fates.

item.title: India growth beats all estimates as factories defy Trump tariffs
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi called the GDP number "very encouraging."

item.title: Ford workers told their CEO ‘none of the young people want to work here.’ So Jim Farley took a page out of the founder’s playbook
item.description: Ford founder Henry Ford decided in 1914 to more than double factory workers' wages to $5 a day, jump-starting the American middle class.

item.title: Nintendo’s secret to becoming a design powerhouse? Developers who have stayed at the company for decades
item.description: “The people who first made Nintendo’s hits are still working at the company,” says Keza MacDonald, author of a forthcoming book about the company.

item.title: Airbus warns A320 fleet needs software fix after incident
item.description: A recent incident involving a Jetblue plane revealed “intense solar radiation” could risk corrupting data critical to maintaining working flight contr...

item.title: Steve Jobs taught Gap’s former CEO that micromanaging can be a good thing
item.description: “I’m proud to be a micromanager for what a customer sees, feels, and hears,” Mickey Drexler said.
